abstract: A view that displays a calendar with date-specific decorations, and provides for user selection of a single date or multiple dates.

codeExamples.code:
// Set the date to display.
calendarView.visibleDateComponents = DateComponents(
    calendar: gregorianCalendar,
    year: 2024,
    month: 2,
    day: 1
)

let dateSelection = UICalendarSelectionSingleDate(delegate: self)
calendarView.selectionBehavior = dateSelection

overview:
## Overview

Use a calendar view to show users specific dates that have additional information (for example, scheduled events) using decorations that you customize. You can also use a calendar view for users to select one specific date, multiple dates, or no date.

To add a calendar view to your interface:

You use a calendar view only for the display and selection of dates. If you want to handle date and time selection, use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker].

### Configure a calendar view

Configure your calendar view to display the type of calendar appropriate to the user’s location and cultural preference, in the user’s preferred language. By default, a calendar view selects the user’s current [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/Calendar] and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/Locale]. If users can select a different calendar or locale in your app, configure the calendar view to use those selections.

Then, set the calendar view’s initial display to a starting date that’s appropriate for your use case.

If you want to restrict the earliest or latest dates a user can view or select in your calendar view, set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICalendarView/availableDateRange].

### Display decorations for specific dates

Use decorations to show users which specific dates have additional information. Add meaning or emphasis to the decorations by setting the color, size, image, or custom view that you display for a specific date. To display decorations in your calendar view, create a custom [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICalendarViewDelegate] object, implement [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICalendarViewDelegate/calendarView(_:decorationFor:)], and set your custom object as the calendar view’s delegate.

In your implementation, you can decide which type of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICalendarView/Decoration] best illustrates your user’s events:

When your data changes, tell the calendar view to reload decoration views.

### Handle date selection

Let users select a single date, multiple dates, or no date with your calendar view. First, decide which type of date selection you want. Then create a selection object and delegate for that type, and assign it to the calendar view’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICalendarView/selectionBehavior].

The user can then select a date from the calendar view. You can set a selected date programmatically as the following example shows:

Next, implement the delegate methods for the selection method to customize your date selection handling.

items.description: The calendar that the calendar view illustrates.
items.name: calendar

items.description: The locale the calendar view uses for calendar conventions.
items.name: locale

items.description: The time zone from the date the calendar view displays.
items.name: timeZone

items.description: The date components that represent the visible date in the calendar view.
items.name: visibleDateComponents

items.description: Sets the date components that represent the date for the calendar view to make visible, with an option to animate the date change.
items.name: setVisibleDateComponents(_:animated:)

items.description: The range of dates that the calendar view displays.
items.name: availableDateRange

sections.title: Setting the visible date and range

items.description: A font design that the calendar view uses for displaying calendar text.
items.name: fontDesign

items.description: A delegate object the calendar view calls for decoration views.
items.name: delegate

items.description: An object that a calendar view uses to display decorations for dates.
items.name: UICalendarViewDelegate

items.description: A view that a calendar view displays for a specific date.
items.name: UICalendarView.Decoration

items.description: Constants that indicate the relative size of a decoration in a calendar view.
items.name: UICalendarView.DecorationSize

items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the calendar view displays date decorations.
items.name: wantsDateDecorations

items.description: Reloads the decorations for the dates you provide, with an option to animate the decoration reload.
items.name: reloadDecorations(forDateComponents:animated:)

items.description: The current date selection method of the calendar view.
items.name: selectionBehavior

items.description: An object that tracks a date the user selects from a calendar view.
items.name: UICalendarSelectionSingleDate

items.description: An object that tracks multiple dates the user selects from a calendar view.
items.name: UICalendarSelectionMultiDate

items.description: An object that tracks a specific week a person selects from a calendar view.
items.name: UICalendarSelectionWeekOfYear

items.description: A base object that tracks one or more dates a user selects from a calendar view.
items.name: UICalendarSelection

items.description: A view that shows that a task is in progress.
items.name: UIActivityIndicatorView

items.description: A view that indicates there’s no content to display.
items.name: UIContentUnavailableView

items.description: A view that displays a single image or a sequence of animated images in your interface.
items.name: UIImageView

items.description: A view that uses a spinning-wheel or slot-machine metaphor to show one or more sets of values.
items.name: UIPickerView

items.description: A view that depicts the progress of a task over time.
items.name: UIProgressView

title: UICalendarView
